00002 //
00003 // KEdwAnalysis.cc
00004 // KEdwDataStructure
00005 //
00006 // Author: Adam Cox <mailto:adam.cox@ik.fzk.de> on 3/25/10.
00007 //
00008 // * Copyright 2010 Karlsruhe Institute of Technology. All rights reserved.
00009 //
00010 // This class could be developed into an interface for many different
00011 // types of analysis algorithms. 
00012 //
00013 // Right now it just opens a file for you and allows you to progress through
00014 // the file, event-by-event, and then gives you the option to save any 
00015 // interesting events (SaveThisEvent) to an output file, in the same KEdwDS format. 
00016 //
00017 // It also has a method that is used with an KEdwEventCollection object.
00018

00034 KEdwAnalysis::KEdwAnalysis(const Char_t* fileName)
00035 {
00036         fFileReader = 0;
00037         fFileWriter = 0;
00038   InitializeMembers();
00039         
00040         if(fileName != 0) 
00041                 OpenEdsFile(fileName);
00042 }

00064 void KEdwAnalysis::CloseOutput(Option_t *anOpt)
00065 {
00066         if(fFileWriter != 0){
00067                 fFileWriter->Close(anOpt);
00068                 delete fFileWriter;
00069                 fFileWriter = 0;
00070         }

00082 Int_t KEdwAnalysis::OpenEdsFile(const Char_t* fileName)
00083 {
00084         fFileReader = new KEdwDSReader(fileName);
00085         if(fFileReader != 0){
00086                 return fFileReader->GetEntries();
00087         }
00088         else return -1;
00089 }

00139 Bool_t KEdwAnalysis::OpenOutputEdsFile(const Char_t* fileName)
00140 {
00141         if(fFileWriter == 0){
00142                 fFileWriter = new KEdwDSWriter(fileName, GetEventClassName());
00143                 return fFileWriter->IsReady();
00144         }
00145         else {
00146                 return false;
00147         }
00148 }

00172 
00173 Int_t KEdwAnalysis::SaveThisEvent(KEdwEventBase* e)
00174 {
00175         //Save a particular event into the output Eds File. 
00176         //The type of the event need not be the same type of
00177         //event expected by the output Eds file (HLA, Raw, etc..)
00178         //However, the output Eds file will contain a single tree
00179         //with a single branch of a particular event type. For example,
00180         //if you call OpenOutputEdsFile("file.root","HLA"), then
00181         //all of the events in file.root will be of type KEdwHLAEvent.
00182         //If you call this method and pass in an event of type KEdwHLAEvent,
00183         //then it will copy it normally into your output file. If you call
00184         //this method and pass in an event of type KEdwRawEvent, then
00185         //the KEdwHLAEvent class will copy all of the base information 
00186         //AND compute any High Level parameters that it can based upon 
00187         //the information that is available in the RawEvent class. 
00188         //The other example is if you call OpenOutputEdsFile("file.root", "Raw").
00189         //If you then call this method and pass in an event of type KEdwRawEvent
00190         //it will copy the event normally. If you call this method
00191         //and pass in an event of type KEdwHLAEvent, it will only copy the
00192         //data members that both classes share - namely, the data members
00193         //that exist in the KEdwEventBase class. Any data members 
00194         //specifically in the KEdwRawEvent
00195         //class (and not in the base class) will not be set. 
00196         //
00197         //Returns -1 if it fails to save the event in your output EDS file
00198         //otherwise returns from KEdwDSWriter::Fill. (TTree::Fill)
00199         
00200         Int_t theRet = -1;
00201                 
00202         if(fFileWriter != 0){
00203                 if(fFileWriter->IsReady()){
00204                         if(e == 0){
00205                                 cout << "KEdwAnalysis::SaveThisEvent(KEdwEventBase *). Argument is NULL" << endl;
00206                                 return theRet;
00207                         }
00208                         else if(fFileWriter->GetEvent() == 0){
00209                                 cout << "KEdwAnalysis::SaveThisEvent(KEdwEventBase *). KEdwDSWriter::GetEvent() is NULL" << endl;
00210                                 return theRet;
00211                         }
00212                         //the type of event (KEdwEventBase, KEdwHLAEvent, KEdwRawEvent, etc..) will
00213                         //be handled appropriatedly by the virtual assignment operator=
00214                         
00215                         //BUG! nope, i don't think that this works!
00216                         *fFileWriter->GetEvent() = *e;
00217                         theRet = fFileWriter->Fill();
00218                         
00219                 }
00220         }
00221         
00222         return theRet;
00223 }
00224 
00225 Int_t KEdwAnalysis::SaveThisEvent(void)
00226 {
00227         //Saves the current event into the output Eds file.
00228         return SaveThisEvent(GetEvent());
00229 }

00231 Int_t KEdwAnalysis::Write(const Char_t* name, Int_t option, Int_t bufsize)
00232 {
00233         //The options are the same as those options in TObject::Write. 
00234     //This writes the output KEdwDS data file to disk.
00235         
00236         if(fFileWriter != 0){
00237                 return fFileWriter->Write(name, option, bufsize);
00238         }
00239         else return -1;
00240 }

00251 
00252 KEdwEventCollection* KEdwAnalysis::GetCoincEvent(KEdwEventCollection *mCoincE, Double_t fForwardTime,
00253                                                                                                                                                                                  Double_t fBackwardTime)
00254 {
00255         //This routine finds, for the current event that the file is pointing to,
00256         //nearby events that match a particular criteria set by the input 
00257         //arguments and packages them into an KEdwEventCollection object. 
00258         //The current set of criteria is only a time window defined by the 
00259         //two variables fForwardTime and fBackwardTime
00260         //If the pointer to the KEdwEventCollection is NULL, this routine will
00261         //make a new object, which you must delete when you're done with it. 
00262         /*
00263          version: 0
00264          This routine only looks for coincidences within a specific time frame.
00265          
00266          In version 0, we only look for coincidences with the time stamp parameter.***
00267          The primary event must have an Energy and Q value in a specified range. 
00268          Then, once that event is found, it searches backwards and forward in time
00269          searching for any other type of event that is specified by another set of 
00270          conditions. 
00271          
00272          ***In order to be more inclusive, this routine should be modified somehow
00273          to search for physics event times by examining the ion pulse offset time.
00274          However, this is difficult with the current data stream because we are
00275          not guaranteed that events are in order in the data stream according to
00276          their physics time. In fact, its probably likely to find events "out of
00277          order" during high-rate situations. These are events where the heat trigger
00278          times are sequenced in a different way that the full reconstructed event
00279          time would have sequenced them. For example, event 1 has a stamp time
00280          of 10000 and the reconstructed ion pulse time is 0. Event 2 has a 
00281          stamp time of 10100, but the reconstructed ion pulse time is -200. So, 
00282          in the data stream Event 2 would come after Event 1, even though 
00283          physically Event 2 occurred before Event 1. Now, imagine a 
00284          series of events like this. If one were to perform a coincidence search, 
00285          its not clear when to stop searching for events away from the event
00286          of interest because the order of events is not guaranteed to be chronological. 
00287          The simplest thing to do would be to search for coincdences
00288          in time that is significantly large - beyond what is reasonably expected -
00289          and then analyze that subset in more detail. 
00290          Another possible work around is to write a new program that will break
00291          up the HLA event structure and re-organize it into an event structure
00292          that is based upon the physics event time ( = time stamp + ion pulse time),
00293          forcing that the events are arranged in the file in order. 
00294          
00295          
00296          */
00297         
00298         KEdwEventBase *anEvent = GetEvent();
00299         
00300         if(anEvent == 0){
00301                 return mCoincE;
00302         }
00303         if(mCoincE == 0) mCoincE = new KEdwEventCollection;
00304         
00305         Int_t fSaveEntry = GetCurrentEntryNumber();
00306         
00307         try {
00308                 
00309                 //NOTE - probably need to come up with an algorithm that
00310                 //will put these coincidence events in chronological order.
00311                 //Could probably just write a method the sorts for you. 
00312                 //could make it happen automatically inside of KEdwEventCollection::AddEvent
00313                 //Or, we just know that the first event in the CoincEvent is always
00314                 //the initial event of interest. 
00315                 //Or, see the WishList for the idea of making objects "Sortable"
00316                 
00317                 
00318                 if(KEdwHLAEvent *mHlaEv = dynamic_cast<KEdwHLAEvent *>(anEvent)){
00319                         //need a routine here to look for events near this particular event
00320                         //given the criteria above. 
00321                         Double_t deltaT = 0;
00322                         Double_t fCurrentTime = mHlaEv->GetStampTime();
00323                         Double_t fTempTime = fCurrentTime;
00324                         deltaT = fabs(fCurrentTime - fTempTime);
00325                         
00326                         mCoincE->AddEvent(mHlaEv);
00327                         
00328                         Bool_t keepGoing = true;
00329                         while(keepGoing){
00330                                 if(GetPreviousEntry() > 0){
00331                                         //cout << "..searching backward...." << endl;
00332                                         mHlaEv = dynamic_cast<KEdwHLAEvent *> (GetEvent());
00333                                         fTempTime = mHlaEv->GetStampTime();
00334                                         deltaT = fabs(fCurrentTime - fTempTime);
00335                                         if(deltaT < fBackwardTime){  
00336                                                 //cout << "adding event" << endl;
00337                                                 mCoincE->AddEvent(mHlaEv);
00338                                         }
00339                                         else
00340                                                 keepGoing = false;
00341                                 }
00342                                 else {
00343                                         keepGoing = false;
00344                                 }
00345                         }
00346                         
00347                         GetEntry(fSaveEntry);
00348                         fCurrentTime = mHlaEv->GetStampTime();
00349                         fTempTime = fCurrentTime;
00350                         deltaT = fabs(fCurrentTime - fTempTime);
00351                         
00352                         keepGoing = true;
00353                         while(keepGoing){
00354                                 if(GetNextEntry() > 0){
00355                                         //cout << "..searching forward...." << endl;
00356                                         mHlaEv = dynamic_cast<KEdwHLAEvent *> (GetEvent());
00357                                         fTempTime = mHlaEv->GetStampTime();
00358                                         deltaT = fabs(fCurrentTime - fTempTime);
00359                                         if(deltaT < fForwardTime) {
00360                                                 //cout << "adding event" << endl;
00361                                                 mCoincE->AddEvent(mHlaEv);
00362                                         }
00363                                         else
00364                                                 keepGoing = false;
00365                                 }
00366                                 else {
00367                                         keepGoing = false;
00368                                 }
00369                         }
00370                         
00371                 }
00372                 else {
00373                         cout << "KEdwAnalysis::GetPhysicsEvent. Sorry, you can only do this with High Level Analysis Events at the moment" << endl;
00374                 }
00375                 
00376         }
00377         catch (bad_cast) {
00378                 //
00379         }
00380         
00381         GetEntry(fSaveEntry);
00382         
00383         return mCoincE;
00384 }
00385  
00386 
00387 Double_t KEdwAnalysis::GetBoloPhysicsEventTime(Int_t i, KEdwHLAEvent *ev) 
00388 {
00389         if(ev == 0)
00390                 ev = dynamic_cast< KEdwHLAEvent *>( this->GetEvent() );
00391         
00392         if(ev != 0){
00393                 KEdwHLASingleBoloSubRecord* bolo = ev->GetBolo(i);
00394                 if(bolo != 0)
00395                         return ev->GetSecPerStamp()*(ev->GetStamp() + bolo->GetIonPulseTimeOffset());
00396                 else 
00397                         return -9999.;
00398         }
00399         else return -9999.;
00400 }
